intro: Ferula tunetana, commonly known as the Tunisian angelica, is a flowering plant native to North Africa. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and feathery leaves. The plant produces yellowish-green flowers in umbels, typical of the family, and is often found in rocky or arid environments. Ferula tunetana is also valued for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional medicine. Its botanical features make it an important species in the study of Mediterranean flora.
